description: From Middle English *berenden, from Old English berendan (“to peel, take off husk”); equivalent to be- +‎ rend.

verbs.description: berend (third-person singular simple present berends, present participle berending, simple past and past participle berent)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To rend or tear severely; tear badly; rip all over.
examples: Then red with ire, her tresses she berent; And weeping hid the beauty of her face:
